page.title: 08Farming
page.content: In the classification of farms used by agricultural economists the farms of Lindean include these types:Hill Sheep,Upland,Rearing and Livestock- with-arable.The single example of a Hill Sheep farm extends to 400 acres and ranges from 200 to over 300 metres above sea level.60 acres are cropped.The remainder is "rough grazing".It is worked by the tenant farmer with occasional casual labour.In reply to a question about his stock he replied: "I've 386 North Country Cheviot ewes and 111 gimmers.The ewes were crossed with Suffolk tups (rams) and I have 450 lambs to sell as stores".The exactness of his reply illustrates not only the intensity of his husbandry but also the narrowness of the margin between his profit and loss.
